column5: After much thought and a lot of rain I have decided it's best to trade in my beloved 1985 Grumman boat motor and trailer for a Ark....don't have any experience with Arks but it seems like the right thing to do...and after I get the Ark I will be collecting the animals...of course some will not be invited.... mosquitoes will not be allowed and it's not looking good for cats either. I guess the round gobies and dreaded zebra mussels wouldn't make the cut either....LOL....any other pest I should leave out...
Cormorants
would that be Tiller or console.What do you have your eyes on Billy B?
I'm thinking both since this is going to be stinky ship and I'll need options...  Black flies will also be on the banned list...
wives....
welded or rivets for that ark?
Leaf Fans??
Asian Carp, and snakes head should be left out too Bob.Go console Bob, that way the weight isnt all in the back
politicians and lampreys ( I know, not a lot of difference, but as we're leaving both behind, thats a moot point)
Who's gonna clean up after Bob I mean the animals?
I hear the duck tape factory is on overtime for this construction feat !
Sure this is the boat you want lol...don't want another trade in in 4 years
lund double counsil...with a top.....i know now i shouldve went with a double counil on my boat instead of a single
Arks only come in solid wood......so welded would be difficult...LOL
Good Point....
Can you ban deerflies and horseflies as well please!!
Don't forget to leave the lawyers behind too.  As for the amnimals, anything that stings or bites (scorpions, wasps, hornets, fire ants, jellyfish,poisonous snakes, spiders)
It seems like a sound idea to me BB, but one question remains... How you gonna launch that thing! HH
Yeah, I have a feeling you might have to get your wheel hubs wet this time.
Good point Roy

You guys and my wheel hubs.....LOL....  :rofl2:  There will be a demonstration of how this is done at Cliff's come June 24th...and bring some cold CANADIAN BEER for lesson payments...LOL..  Now back to more serious matters....what size outboard should I be looking at...probably a BIG 4 stroker...or maybe a E-Tech ?
Hey BB, check out the F650 thread, might be an answer to your towing concerns! HH
A couple of Cummins b series would do the trick if you could sync the props Bob
errrrrr....need something more dependable...I'll still with my Tundra...
